locale.message: Access log options
Create log files

Activating this option will make the plugin create access log files inside the files directory. Those files should be used to extract the usage statistics data. If you don't want to create more access log files you can leave this option disabled and use your own server log access files.
Parse log files regex

The default regex used can parse apache access log files in combined format and also the plugin's log files. If your access log files are in a different format you will have to insert a regex capable of parsing them and giving the expected values. See UsageStatsLoader::_getDataFromLogEntry() for more information.
Usage statistics plugin settings saved
Data privacy option

In order to be able to activate this option, the file where the salt will be saved has to be defined: insert the section '[usageSats]' in the config.inc.php and define the variable 'salt_filepath' there. The file must exist and it must be writable for the web user. For further information on the requirements for this plugin option please see the plugin README file.

Activate this option if you would like to use a plugin version that considers the privacy legislations: the logged IP addresses are hashed using a daily randomly generated salt, the users are informed about the tracking and an opt-out option is provided for the users. Note: using this option you will not be able to use the geo location features of the plugin.
